articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Ri Ul Sol
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Ri Ul Sol
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent a wreath to the bier of Marshal of the Korean People's Army Ri Ul Sol, member of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Sunday, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Foreign Party, State Leaders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Foreign Party, State Leaders
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent messages to foreign party and state leaders in reply to their messages of greeting on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 They included Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, Xi Jinping, general secretary of the Central Committee of the  Communist Party of China, Choummaly Saynasone, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and chairman of the Central Committee of Defence and Security of Laos, Bashar Al-Assad, president of Syria, Mahmoud Abbas, president of Palestine and chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization, Nguyen Phu Trong, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, and Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir, president of Sudan.
					
					 Kim Jong Un in his reply messages expressed deep thanks to them for their sincere congratulations and wishes on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the WPK.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and relevant countries would continue to develop in the future, too, and wished them successes in their work.

articles.title: Ri Ul Sol Dies
articles.content:
Ri Ul Sol Dies
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Marshal of the Korean People's Army (KPA) Ri Ul Sol, member of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA), died to the sorrow of the Korean people at the age of 94 at 10:10 on November 7, Juche 104 (2015) while receiving the treatment of lung cancer for a long time.
					 Born into a poor peasant family in Kim Chaek City, North Hamgyong Province on September 14, Juche 10 (1921), Ri was an anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter and veteran revolutionary loyal to the WPK as he devoted his all to winning the victory in the cause of national and class liberation and developing the KPA into invincible revolutionary armed forces going in the military uniform of the revolution all his life at the outpost for devotedly defending the Party and leaders.
					
					 He dedicated his all to the sacred cause of liberating the country by participating in the glorious anti-Japanese armed struggle led by President Kim Il Sung in the dark period of the Japanese imperialist rule.
					
					 Holding important posts of the KPA after the liberation of the country, he protected Kim Il Sung with arms at the risk of his life and devoted himself to developing the KPA.
					
					As regiment commander and vice division commander in charge of military affairs of the KPA during the Fatherland Liberation War, he made great contributions to beating back the U.S. imperialists' invasion and winning the victory in the war and performed distinguished feats in defending the Korean revolution as chief adjutant of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Holding important posts of the guard unit and the supreme command after working as commanding officer of a combined unit and large combined units of the KPA after the war, he devoted himself to firmly establishing the unitary leadership of the supreme commander over the whole army, thoroughly implementing the Party's Juche-based military line and firmly guaranteeing the revolutionary cause of Juche and Songun with matchless military muscle.
					
					 He worked as alternate member of the Party Central Committee from October, Juche 55 (1966), member of the Party Central Committee from November, Juche 59 (1970), was elected deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly from Juche 51 (1962), worked as member of the Party Central Military Commission from October, Juche 69 (1980) to September, Juche 99 (2010) and member of the National Defence Commission from May, Juche 79 (1990) to September, Juche 92 (2003).
					
					 He was awarded three Orders of Kim Il Sung, Order of Kim Jong Il, watches bearing the august name of Kim Il Sung, title of Twice Hero of the DPRK, title of Labor Hero and other high commendations of the Party and the state for the distinguished feats he performed for the Party, the revolution, the country and its people.
					
					 He was awarded the title of the KPA Marshal in October, Juche 84 (1995).
					
					 An obituary of Ri Ul Sol was published on Nov. 7 in the joint name of the Central Committee of the WPK, the WPK Central Military Commission, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
					
					 The obituary said that though Ri passed away, the exploits he performed for the Party, the revolution, the country and its people would shine forever with the triumphant advance of the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 That day the Central Committee of the WPK, the WPK Central Military Commission, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK announced that the deceased would be accorded a state funeral and formed the state funeral committee with supreme leader Kim Jong Un as chairman of the committee and 170 persons including Kim Yong Nam as members of the committee.
					
					 The funeral committee said that the coffin would be laid at the Central Hall of Workers and it would receive mourners from 16:00 on November 8 to 19:00 on November 10 and the coffin would be carried out of the hall at 09:00 on November 11.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Cambodian King
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Cambodian King
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Norodom Sihamoni, king of Cambodia, on Sunday on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message said the Korean people are sincerely rejoiced over the great achievements made by the Cambodian people in their work for defending the sovereignty of the country and achieving its prosperity under the leadership of the king.
					
					 The message expressed belief that traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, sincerely wishing the king good health and happiness.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets Cambodian PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets Cambodian PM
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju sent a message of greeting to Hun Sen, prime minister of Cambodia, on Sunday on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the future, wishing the prime minister greater success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a similar message to Hor Nam Hong, deputy prime minister and minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Cambodia, on the same day.

articles.title: Cooperation with Outsiders Would Lead S. Korea to Destruction: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Cooperation with Outsiders Would Lead S. Korea to Destruction: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The trend toward the inter-Korean relations and the situation surrounding the Korean Peninsula require the south Korean authorities to come out for national unity and cooperation, free from chronic dependence on outsiders and cooperation with them.
					 Rodong Sinmun says this in an article Sunday.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are working hard to do harm to the fellow countrymen in the north through military collusion with Japan with the backing of the U.S. but this would bring humiliation and disgrace to them, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 This is evidenced by the controversial "U.S.-Japan Defence Cooperation Guidelines" for aggression which was retrogressively revised again by the U.S. and Japan at the end of April. Half a year has passed since then but south Korea still has been affected by it. The key contents of the new "guidelines" is that Japan's "Self-Defense Forces" could stage military operation as they please on the Korean Peninsula in disregard of south Korea under the pretext of the military cooperation with the U.S. forces both in case of contingency and in peace time, pursuant to the U.S. strategy for launching a war of aggression.
					
					 In a word, the Japanese reactionaries are trying to officially join a war of aggression on Korea and for world domination at the tacit connivance of the U.S., after getting rid of the restraint of a criminal state. 
					
					 However, the south Korean ruling quarters are inviting derision and denunciation from the public at home and abroad for actively supporting their American and Japanese masters while crying out for the "respect of sovereignty." Their cooperation with outsiders against the north and their blind pursuance of the U.S. and Japan will bring them humiliation and disgrace.
					
					 No matter how often they may stage smear campaign with outsiders to isolate and stifle the DPRK, they would face curse and criticism by the nation and disgrace in the international eyes.
					
					 The south Korean authorities had better be mindful that cooperation with foreign forces would lead them to shameful destruction.

articles.title: UN Has to Be Reformed: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
UN Has to Be Reformed: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- UN celebrated its 70th founding anniversary on Oct. 24 following the opening of the 70th UN General Assembly on Sept. 15. 
					 Humankind, reviewing the 70-year-long history of the UN, presents more urgently the issue of the substantial reform of the UN.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 In the past seven decades the UN has failed to properly fulfill its responsibility as an international organization with the mission to safeguard the global peace and security and, furthermore, the UN Security Council has been abused as a means for patronizing and justifying some specified countries' biased and optional assertions and views.
					
					 Therefore, not a few countries demand a reform of the UN Security Council as it speaks for big powers only.
					
					 The international community demands the UN reform for the purpose of ensuring impartiality and equality in the settlement of the relevant regional issues and global issues through the increase in the number of members of the council, safeguarding global peace and security and defending justice and truth. This is the principle as well as the essence of the reform.
					
					 If those countries which are set to misuse the council membership as a means of realizing their selfish purposes or as a throne for their willful acts, they would be useless no matter how many they are.
					
					 It is of significance for the developing countries to own the membership of the council.
					
					 Permanent members of the council are by no means elder representatives. They are obliged to be faithful to their missions rather than their rights, keeping in mind the responsibility entrusted by the international community upon them.
					
					 Only when all the countries including the permanent members of the council work to establish the fair international relations, the UN reform will be successfully carried out and peace and security be ensured in the world.
					
					 This is the fundamental requirement of the world people.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Cooperation with Foreign Forces for War Moves against DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Cooperation with Foreign Forces for War Moves against DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- There took place the 40th military committee meeting between the U.S. and south Korean authorities recently. At the meeting the south Korean warmongers held a confab with their master over the "proposal for intensifying joint defense posture" and transfer of wartime operation control. At the 47th annual security consultative meeting held the next day they published a 16-point "joint statement" the core of which are "guidelines of concept and principle of package counter-missile operation of the alliance" and the "plan for transferring wartime operation control", while talking about someone's "aggression" and "provocation".
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says:
					
					 The military confabs were aimed to round off a scenario for invading the north and ignite a war at any cost.
					
					 The "plan for transferring wartime operation control" discussed at the confabs is a product of the sinister ploy of the master and servant to put greater spurs to the preparations for a war against the north.
					
					 The south Korean military forces are staging war maneuvers against the DPRK together with foreign forces almost every day, getting on the nerves of it and inciting a war atmosphere.
					
					 It is the invariable stand of the DPRK to return good faith for good faith and toughest action for tough action. If the south Korean authorities persist in the racket for a war against the north in league with foreign forces, defying its repeated warnings, they will face a final ruin.
					
					 They would be well advised to face up to the reality, make a political decision suited to the trend and stop at once cooperation with foreign forces for a war against the north.

articles.title: Korean Photo, Book and Fine Art Exhibition Opens in Russia
articles.content:
Korean Photo, Book and Fine Art Exhibition Opens in Russia
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A Korean photo, book and fine art exhibition opened at the Far Eastern National Science Library of Russia on Nov. 2.
					 Displayed at the venue of the exhibition were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and other books, photos showing the true picture of Songun Korea and fine art works associated with the resourcefulness and talents of the Korean people.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were the first vice-minister of Culture of the Khabarovsk Territory Administration of Russia, a vice-president of the library and other Russians and officials of the DPRK mission in Khabarovsk.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket, bouquets and flowers before the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 The first vice-minister of Culture of the Khabarovsk Territory Administration of Russia said that the exhibition marked a good occasion in showing the cultural exchange between Russia and the DPRK developing day by day.
					
					 The first vice-minister expressed belief that colorful cultural cooperation and exchange between Khabarovsk and the DPRK would make clear contribution to developing friendly relations between the people of the two countries.
					
					 The vice-president of the library said that various events held here this year helped Khabarovsk citizens know better about the reality of Korea and its time-honored history.

articles.title: DPRK Introduced in Guinea, Germany
articles.content:
DPRK Introduced in Guinea, Germany
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A lecture, film show and photo exhibition introducing the DPRK took place in Guinea and Germany on Oct. 30.
					 On display at the venue of the photo exhibition were photos dealing with the celebrations of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Mirae Scientists Street and Sci-Tech Complex.
					
					 Korean film "Masikryong Ski Resort" was shown.
					
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany said at the photo exhibition that Mirae Scientists Street successfully built on the occasion of the WPK's 70th birthday is a model of the construction field in all aspects such as the construction style, quality of buildings, construction speed and harmony of surrounding sceneries.
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK will certainly turn into a thriving socialist nation in the near future thanks to the warm love, trust and wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un who presents the people with such wonderful street and modern apartment houses and Sci-tech Complex.
					
					 He expressed his envy at the Korean people who are enjoying all blessings and sound and civilized life under the care of the great leader in the socialist paradise unimaginable in the capitalist society.

articles.title: DPRK's Proposal for Concluding Peace Treaty Supported by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
DPRK's Proposal for Concluding Peace Treaty Supported by Nigerian Organization
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- An article titled "Conclusion of peace treaty between DPRK and U.S. is urgent task for settling issue of Korean Peninsula" was posted by the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on its website on Oct. 27.
					 The article said that the DPRK's proposal for concluding a peace treaty with the U.S. at an early date to defuse the danger of a war and create a peaceful climate on the Korean Peninsula is commanding positive support of the world peace-loving people.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The DPRK has consistently proposed to replace the present Armistice Agreement (AA) with a peace treaty.
					
					 The crisis on the Korean Peninsula which reached the brink of a war in last August proved that the AA can no longer stem the collision and danger of a war and that the urgent task for creating a lasting peaceful climate in the region is just to conclude a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. is driving the situation on the peninsula into an extreme pitch of tension, persistently seeking its hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 All facts prove that the wisest way of settling the issue of the peninsula is to conclude a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 Peace on the peninsula cannot be ensured unless a peace treaty is concluded.
					
					 The U.S. should not insist on the DPRK's abandonment of nuclear program and kick off nuclear confrontation but respond to the DPRK's crucial proposal for replacing the AA with a peace treaty as soon as possible.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Egypt
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Egypt
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- An Egyptian committee for remembering the great General Kim Jong Il was formed by the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt on Nov. 3.
					 Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, vice-chairman of the party and chairman of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to significantly organize a seminar on leader Kim Jong Il's works, seminar on his exploits, photo exhibition and other political and cultural events from Nov. 5 to Dec. 17.

articles.title: Fallecido Ri Ul Sol
articles.content:
Fallecido Ri Ul Sol
Pyongyang, 8 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El mariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea Ri Ul Sol, miembro del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, fallecio lamentablemente a las 10:10 del dia 7 a los 94 anos de edad al cabo de larga asistencia medica por el cancer pulmonar.
					Nacido el 14 de septiembre del 10(1921) de la Era Juche en una pobre familia campesina en la ciudad Kim Chaek de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, Ri Ul Sol fue un combatiente revolucionario antijapones y veterano revolucionario fiel al PTC quien durante toda su vida en la linea avanzada del frente de la defensa a ultranza al Partido y al Lider, dedico lo todo a lograr la victoria de la causa de liberacion nacional y de la clasista y a fortalecer el EPC como las invencibles fuerzas armadas revolucionarias.
					
					En el periodo muy tenebroso de la dominacion del imperialismo japones, participo en la gloriosa lucha armada antijaponesa organizada por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y dedico todo lo suyo a la sagrada causa para la liberacion de la patria.
					
					Trabajando de importantes cargos del ejercito popular despues de la liberacion, defendio con armas a costa de la vida al Presidente y lucho abnegadamente por el fortalecimiento del EPC.
					
					En el periodo de la guerra de liberacion de la patria, siendo jefe del regimiento y subjefe militar de division del EPC, hizo gran aporte a frustrar la agresion armada de los imperialistas norteamericanos y llevarla a la victoria e hizo meritos sobresalientes a defender la revolucion coreana como jefe de ayudantes del Presidente.
					
					Desde la posguerra, permaneciendo como miembro de mando de unidades combinadas y grandes unidades combinadas del EPC y en cargos importantes de la unidad de escolta y de la Comandancia Suprema lucho con abnegacion por establecer con firmeza en todo el ejercito el sistema de unica direccion del Comandante Supremo, materializar cabalmente la autoctona linea militar del Partido y garantizar firmemente con el invencible poderio militar la causa revolucionaria del Juche, la del Songun.
					
					Desde octubre del 55(1966) de la Era Juche trabajo como miembro suplente del Comite Central del PTC, desde noviembre del 59(1970) de la Era Juche como miembro del CC del PTC, desde el 51(1962) de la Era Juche como diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema, desde octubre del 69(1980) de la Era Juche hasta septiembre del 99(2010) de la Era Juche como miembro de la Comision Militar Central del PTC y desde mayo del 79(1990) hasta el 92(2003) de la Era Juche como miembro del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC.
					
					Por sus meritos prominentes acumulados ante el Partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo, Ri Ul Sol fue condecorado con 3 Ordenes Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il y recibio el reloj con el nombre del Presidente, el titulo de doble Heroe de la Republica y de Heroe del Trabajo y otras condecoraciones partidistas y estatales de alto rango.
					
					Le fue otorgado en octubre del 84(1995) de la Era Juche el titulo de mariscal del EPC.
					
					El dia 7, fue publicada la esquela mortuaria en nombre comun del CC del PTC, la Comision Militar Central del PTC, el Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC y el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC.
					
					La nota subraya que aunque Ri fallecio, sus meritos hechos ante el Partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo brillaran para siempre junto con el avance victorioso de la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					Este dia, el CC del PTC, la Comision Militar Central del PTC, el Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC y el Presidium de la APS de la RPDC publicaron realizar los funerales del difunto Ri Ul Sol como los de caracter nacional y compusieron el Comite Funerario Estatal, cuyo presidente es el Mariscal Kim Jong Un y cuyos miembros son 170 miembros inclusive Kim Yong Nam.
					
					El Comite funerario aviso que el ataud del difunto esta colocado en la Casa Central de Obreros, recibira a los asistentes al funeral desde las 16 del dia 8 hasta las 19 del dia 10 y sacara a las 9 del dia 11 el ataud de casa para el entierro.
